meanings.definition: A method or rule used to determine a winner when competitors have tied in a competition.
meanings.sent1: In the soccer match, the tiebreaker was a penalty shootout.
meanings.sent2: The tiebreaker in the chess tournament was a sudden death round.
meanings.sent3: The tiebreaker involving a coin toss added an element of surprise to the game.
meanings.sent4: The tiebreaker acted as a decisive factor in crowning the champion.
meanings.sent5: The tiebreaker system ensured a fair outcome in the event of a tie.

meanings.definition: A game or round played to break a tie between two or more competitors.
meanings.sent1: The tennis match went into a tiebreaker to determine the winner.
meanings.sent2: The tiebreaker in the basketball game was intense and thrilling.
meanings.sent3: The tiebreaker round turned the competition into a nail-biting event.
meanings.sent4: The tiebreaker became the final showdown between the top players.
meanings.sent5: The tiebreaker round was the ultimate decider in the match.
